hackathon-description-text: Hack Western is an all-inclusive 36-hour event where students of all backgrounds from across Canada and the U.S. gather at Western University to create and innovate. The event is entirely student run in partnership with amazing sponsors and speakers. Hack Western provides a welcoming atmosphere for students to create anything from a mobile app, fancy hardware application, to the next big thing!
hackathon-eligibility: Any participant attending Hack Western 2015, from March 27, 2015 to March 29, 2015.
hackathon-rules:
The Hack Western organizing team reserves the right to disqualify project submissions that do not adhere to the following guidelines. Please contact a Hack Western Organizer if you have any questions regarding these guidelines.

Projects can be completed individually or in a group with a maximum size of 4 students. All team members must be approved, registered Hack Western attendees present at the event.

All code written for Hack Western must be written between 11:30PM on Friday, March 27th, 2015 and 10:00AM on Sunday, March 29th, 2015 with the exception of code taken from public and open source libraries, APIs, or tutorials.

All hardware assembled for Hack Western must be assembled between 11:30PM on Friday March 27th and 10:00AM on Sunday March 29th, with the exception of manufactured parts that do not require soldering or assembly with a breadboard outside of the factory (such as robotic arms, Myos, or 3D printed parts).

All art assets brought into Hack Western for your project must be free and publicly available.

Students are free to bring codeless wireframes for the layout of their projects. Hardware may be prototyped in advance to optimize the shape and size of parts, but the actual project presented for submission must be assembled at Hack Western.

The final product must be original: it must not be the same as the product of a tutorial, a submission to a previous hackathon, or a personal project completed before Hack Western. Attendees are trusted to ensure the originality of their projects in good faith. Hack Western retains the right to inspect the source code of projects in case of dispute. All projects and intellectual property produced at Hack Western belong to the attendees who produced it.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: For each member of the team:
For each member of the team: Sennheiser headphones + Graphic Stock accounts + GitHub premium accounts
For each member of the team: Google Chromecast + Graphic Stock accounts + GitHub premium accounts
Awarded to the teams who made it to the Top 6.
For each member of the team: GIANT Android plushie.
Presented by the Hack Western 2015 organizers: one amazing Pusheen plushie for each team member.
Presented by Flipp: one Nintendo 3DS for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best App That Saves People Money

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Presented by Microsoft: (1) Xbox One for the best use of Microsoft Azure
Presented by Big Blue Bubble: Google Chromecast for each member of the team
Presented by Kik: $100 Futureshop Gift card + Kik swag bags for each member of the team
Presented by Kids Code Jeneusse: fancy notebook + graphic design
Presented by Mashape: one Quadcopter for each team member
Presented by Ivey Entrepreneurship: $500 for the team with the app that best uses Artificial Intelligence
Presented by Yahoo: one iPhone 6 for the team, and $100 in Flickr Photobook Credits for each team member
Presented by Spark: Maker Kit + Spark notebooks for each member of the team
Presented by Thalmic: one Myo armband for each member of the team
Presented by Muse: one Muse EEG headband for each team member
Presented by Pebble: one original Pebble watch for each team member
Presented by Magnet Forensics: one Raspberry Pi Kit for each team member
Presented by MLH: team that best uses Amazon Web Services will receive one external hard drive for each member of the team.
Presented by Kobo: Kobo eReader for each member of the team
Presented by Info-Tech: One Leap Motion for each member of the team.
